physical_examinations.vital_signs: Bilirubin: 314 mmol/L, ALT: 87.5 mkat/L, Prothrombin time: 21.3 s, INR: 1.85, D-dimer: 1380.0 ng/mL, AT III: 31%
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Hepatic encephalopathy noted; elevated bilirubin and ALT levels; significant deterioration in coagulation parameters.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Clinical course demonstrated gradual worsening with progression to fulminant hepatic failure during the first week after admission; subsequent prompt correction of coagulopathy and normal laboratory parameters after treatment.
